title: Distributive Property
text: Using the distributive property, we see that subtracting 20% is the same as multiplying by $$(1-0.20)$$: $$22.50-(0.20(22.50))=(1-0.20)(22.50)$$
speech: Using the distributive property, we see that subtracting 20% is the same as multiplying by  times, parentheses 1 minus 0.20,  :  22.50 minus, parentheses, 0.20 times 22.50,  is equal to parentheses 1 minus 0.20,  times 22.50

:   22.50 minus, , 0.20 times 22.50,  is equal to  1 minus 0.20,  times 22.50

title: Multiplication
text: Multiplying by $$1-0.20=0.80$$ is the same thing as finding $$80$$ percent. Adding 10% is the same as multiplying by $$1+0.1$$: $$18+\operatorname{0.1}\left(18\right)=18\left(1+0.1\right)$$
speech: Multiplying by  1 minus 0.20, is equal to 0.80  is the same thing as finding  80  percent. Adding 10% is the same as multiplying by  1 plus 0.1 :  18, plus 0.1 of 18 is equal to 18 times, parentheses 1 plus 0.1,

title: Multiplication
text: Multiplying by $$1+0.1=1.10$$ is the same thing as finding $$110$$ percent. Thus, Katie's method is correct.
speech: Multiplying by  1 plus 0.1, is equal to, 1.10  is the same thing as finding  110  percent. Thus, Katie's method is correct.
